name: Hilton Budapest - Castle District

reviews.text: Title sums it up. This hotel is an older but well-maintained hotel. Hotel also architecturally fits into the district. Doesn't clash with local architecture like some hotels across the river (e.g., Intercontinental, etc.) In fact, if you walk across the Chain Bridge at night, you'll see the hotel lit up but not realize it is relatively new compared to the rest of the district.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in a perfect location in a beautiful city

reviews.text: Service was excellent and friendly. Location is in the famous Castle District and I mean right in the Castle District. Literally adjacent Fisherman's Bastion and the beautiful Matthias Church. The Palace with museums is about 10 minutes away by walk (relatively flat). Also close by is the very interesting Hospital in the Rock. As Castle District is on top of a hill, excellent view of other side of Budapest including the beautiful Parliament Building (well worth a tour - about a 25 minute walk across Chain Bridge downhill). Nearest subway and HEV stop is Betthany Ter - about a 10 minute walk downhill (15 minutes uphill). You can take the HEV easily to Szentendre from that stop.
reviews.title: Excellent Hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast in the Icon restaurant was usual international Hilton buffet style. Lots of good breads. Usual US fare of bacon, eggs, sausages, etc.
reviews.title: Older but exquisite!

reviews.text: As a diamond member (74 nights so far in Hilton family hotels) was upgraded to executive floor with lounge access. Was travelling with a family friends so got corner rooms with shared door. Very nice and large. Clean. Well maintained. Rooms overlooked the Church courtyard but ask for a room overlooking the Danube (or simply walk outside to Fisherman's Bastion for an amazing view). Executive lounge was fine and had a good happy hour with food and beer, wine, etc.
reviews.title: Excellent View and excellent service

reviews.text: Gym was small but adequate since not used by many people when I was there. Treadmills, weight machines and a smaller selection of free weights.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.text: I'd flown through Budapest Airport twice so I was determined that on my third visit, I would actually leave the airport!
reviews.title: Stunning location

likes.liked: — The location - the views, the history, etc.

reviews.title: Budapest Hilton Castle
reviews.text: I booked a weekend break at the Hilton Budapest in Buda on the Hilton website. I picked this from the Hiltons on offer in this city as it had great rates and good reviews on Trip Advisor.

And we were not disappointed! Arriving on a winter's evening, we travelled through Pest and up the small hill into the Castle District. I may classify myself as a veteran traveller but this trip was one of the most magical ever. Imagine! We enjoyed the trip to a hotel - that says a lot about the location.
reviews.title: Great Views and Excellent Customer Service!

reviews.text: The Castle District is a UN preservation site and the hotel is cut into the side of it. The atmosphere, the buildings and the views are beyond compare. It was pleasant to walk around and the public transport (bus 16 from outside the Meridian Hotel in Pest) was regular and cheap.
reviews.title: Good hotel, Bar prices high

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel? One of the better Hiltons I have stayed in and, with the exception of a few staff who needed to study the benefits of smiling, everything else was fine. The room was larger than average and the view from the bedroom was wonderful. We had breakfast each day which was again above average - providing a great choice for those from the east and west. We also ate supper one night in the bar and it was standard Hilton fare which, when you are exhausted from sight seeing, is a comfort in itself!
reviews.title: Amazing Place!

likes.liked: — Location, appearance and the wine cellar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a great hotel in a good location. The only problem w/ location was it's up the hill every night. There are many good restaurants near by. Fortuna, CafePierrot, Rivalda. We opted for the exzecutive room. Well worth it. The staff in exec. lounge were excellent. Rooms were comfortable. Air did not work all that great but it was cool nights. Recommend using Zona Taxi from the airport and back.
reviews.title: great place

reviews.text: This hotel is in an awesome location in Budapest. Very quiet but right in Castle District. Great View of the Danube River- Parliament etc.. Easy to walk to great tourist sites. Good restaurants close by, neat atmosphere in Hotel and superb service.
reviews.title: Loved the Hilton Budapest

likes.liked: — Location and great attention from staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hilton Budapest is absolutely in the best location of the city. the views are amazing, lots of local sites, great restaurants within 5 minutes walking and a very modern, well-kept hotel. We stayed using Hilton points and were given a fantastic view of the Danube. Very helpful and friendly staff including the concierge. The best way to get to the hotel is to book a taxi through the hotel. they give you the best service and best price - to and from the airport. You can easily walk to sites on the other side of the river across the chain bridge. it takes 30 minutes and a nice walk. if it is raining, you will want to take a cab though.
reviews.title: Loved the location and the qulaity of hotel

reviews.text: Hilton Budapest, Castle District is top notch. We stayed 3 nights in July. Location is up on the hill with spectacular views. If you can swing it, pay extra to stay in a room with a Danube view - it is worth it. Rooms are good size, large baths, very comfortable beds!
reviews.title: Excellent in Every Way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a Hilton Honors member we had access to Executive Lounge. Food and beverages were excellent in Lounge. Also ate downstairs for breakfast. Very good buffet for breakfast. Service is Excellent. If you are Honors member there is a separate staff in Exec Lounge to assist you. All the staff are top notch. Special thanks to Beatriz who did an outstanding job of arranging dinners, a birthday surprise and travel arrangements.
reviews.title: Recommend Hilton Bdapest - Castle District

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton Buda in Budapest for four nights during Grand Prix weekend. This was our second visit to Budapest as we stayed at the Gellert Hotel in August 2005 (see my review of that stay). On check in the female receptionist was very helpful answering our questions and readily giving information. My requests for the room had been fulfiled in that we were allocated a room on a high floor and were able to see the Danube from the room. The room was excellent, very clean , a good size and well planned. Our bags were delivered to our room by an equally helpful employee who appeared to be very keen to help us in any way he could and did not hover in anticipation of a tip . Breakfast was very good with plenty of choice to suit all tastes. We encountered the concierge quite a few times and he was always happy to help us in whatever capacity. We used the bar once a day and again all staff were pleasant and helpful.. At no time could i fault anything in this hotel. The hotel's position has been commented on in other reviews but there is no problem crossing to the Pest side of the city, number 16 bus is both frequent and cheap. The view from the Hilton is excellent. This is definitely the hotel to stay at in Budapest. The cost for four nights at the hotel was £372 including breakfast. Brilliant.
reviews.title: Fantastis hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hilton for our Silver Wedding celebrations and were totally delighted with the City and Hotel
reviews.title: The only place to stay in Budapest

reviews.text: We arrived at the very beautiful Castle District of the city and from the moment we stepped out of our car to the day we we departed the hotel staff were kind considerate, helpful and courteous
reviews.title: Recommend the Hilton Budapest

reviews.text: As this was a special occassion for us we asked for a room with a view of the Danube and boy did they deliver, the view from our room was stunning
reviews.title: Pleasant hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This made our stay all the more special and when we return to Budapest as I am sure we will as it is such a magical place we would only consider staying at the Budapest Hilton
reviews.title: Beautiful location

likes.liked: — The ambiance of the hotel and location

reviews.title: Built into the old castle wall
reviews.text: I always try to get the best view in places where views are open and offer great things to see. With the rooms facing the river you look through the incredible architecture of the old castle wall and on the opposite side of the river is the magnificent Parliament building, an incredible building to say the least. Next to the hotel is a really nice cathedral well worth spending some time in. The hotel is comfortable, clean and what is generally typical of the Hilton brand which is not always worthy of a 5 ranking, but the setting makes this one unique enough to put it at the top. I am a hotel owner so I know quality and see the subtle things many guests may not.

reviews.title: The Best View
reviews.text: My wife and I have stayed at many Hilton properties. We can safely say the Hilton Budapest in the Castle District is our favorite. Let's dispense with comments about the service. It is what you would expect at a Hilton: friendly, efficient, and comfortable. What sets this Hilton apart is its location and the view you get. If you go, try to get a room in the 70s or 80s (e.g. 472 or 484). That way, every morning you will rise from your bed to be greeted by a magnificent view of the Danube and an equally magnificent view of the Parliament building. The restaurant where a generous breakfast is served also overlooks the Danube. And if you want to just stroll outside, you are just a few steps from St. Mathias Church and Fisherman's Bastion. A bit down the road is the Grand Palace and several museums. After the hordes of tourists are gone (tour buses tend to come in the morning), you can stroll leisurely around this charming district. There are many restaurants around, many with live music. And as far as transportation is concerned, the #16 bus runs every several minutes right to Deak Ferenc Square where Budapest's 3 subway lines meet up and where you are not too far from a tram stop. In other words, you are not isolated just because you are up on a beautiful hill location overlooking Buda.

reviews.title: Excellent Stay!
reviews.text: Had the pleasure of staying one night at this lovely hotel in the beautiful Castle District. After an overnight flight, our room was ready upon our mid-morning arrival. The 3rd bed we requested was already being set up even before we reached the room. Room was spacious even with extra bed and had plenty of storage; bathroom was large with nice toiletries. Everything was spic and span clean. We did not have a river view but our room was very quiet. The breakfast buffet was excellent but will set you back a hefty 28 euro pp.

reviews.title: Wonderful hotel--I love this place
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night at the end of our Danube cruise. I had found a great rate on the Hilton website. The hotel is in the Castle District on the Buda side of Budapest. This is the nicer part of town, and there is restricted access by car to this area. Therefore, the hotel is very quiet at night. And it is in the middle of a great area to just walk around and explore.

reviews.title: We loved it!!! Perfect trip!!!
reviews.text: On check in in the lobby, the guy at the front desk immediately sent us up to the executive lounge to check in there since my husband is Hilton Honors Gold. We checked in about 9 am, but our room (upgraded) was ready, and they offered us breakfast in the lounge, which was quite extensive with hot and cold selections. The lounge was right by our room, so we could drop in easily for drinks all day. They have snacks all day and a pretty extensive lay out of food, wine, beer in the evening. If you wanted to, you could probably only eat here and be just fine. Also there are computers you can use.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great but the price, even discounted, for a one-bedroom river-view suite is insane as both guestrooms and common areas, including executive lounge, look they never were refurbished since the 70s.
reviews.title: Superb location at steep price and soviet-era feel

reviews.text: Picked this hotel after reading the reviews here, and it's just perfect. Only disappointment is the Gym, very old equipment, substandard. And the hefty price of the breakfast buffet, I think euros 27 is a little bit too much
reviews.title: Great hotel, perfect location, stunnig views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I chose this Hilton for re-visiting Budapest after 15 years. So I did not want it left to chance to stay in a welcoming room with a nice view. Hilton offers rooms with Danube view and in many instances (though not in all) Hilton proved to be of reliable quality.
reviews.title: Well cared for

reviews.text: On arrival we were upgraded to the executive floor which was, of course, a hugh benefit. Drinks and food choices in the executive lounge were very good. Staff was friendly, though a little indifferent at time at reception, concierge and breakfast restaurant. The atmosphere in the breakfast restaurant was rather bustling and not very much inviting for my taste. We tried the Lobby bar once and were quite surprised to pay for 2 club sandwiches and 2 glasses of wine the equivalent of 55 Euros. This is much compared to other restaurants in direct neighbourhood.
reviews.title: It's as good as they say

likes.disliked: — the lack of a continental breakfast option

reviews.title: GreatService
reviews.text: The room was spacious, the bed had a very good mattress, the bathroom was big. And the view gorgeous. The thing is that this side of the hotel had morning sun only.
This hotel is in agreat location in the Historical district of Buda. Close walk to many attactions.
reviews.title: Great Location Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff were very helpful.
reviews.title: Saved the whole holiday!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The decor is nice but dated.... but still very comfortable. This is not a hip hotel. Modern gym and sauna.
reviews.title: Loved the location. Gorgeous

reviews.text: The excutive club is worth spending the extra. It provides free food and drink all day. Great selection of beers and wine areincluded.
reviews.title: Unbeatable view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A nice stay.
reviews.title: Absolutely brill

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Hilton is indeed impressive; not overdone or flashy, it is located within the castle walls in an almost fairy tale setting. Our room overlooked the Danube and the Pest side of the city. The staff was very nice, attentive and highly professional. We stayed on the executive level and received plenty of great snacks, drinks, fruits and sweets; it was all well worth the added expense -- especially after eating big lunches at such superb places as Rosenstein's and Cyrano's. The room we had was typically arranged while the bed was very comfortable. The refrigerator was well stocked but take note: there is a CBA grocery just a block and a half down the street, east of the hotel, that has everything you need for about half the price. Everyone we ran into was most helpful -- from the bus driver who stopped and picked us up beyond the pickup point where we were on our way to the bus stop. We found the locals to be very good and willing to speak english. The metro is ever bit as good as the travel guides indicated. There was no need to use a taxi -- thereby avoiding the reported infamous taxi ripoffs we have heard about. Getting to the hotel was easy via the 'red metro' to the Moscow terrace station and connecting to bus 16, up the stairs and on the street across from the metro exit. Budapest is really a wondeful city and full of surprises -- from the large mall in the west end and the huge market in the south of the vaci utca and of course the large riverfronts. We enjoyed the Hilton and the city -- they go well in hand together as they have for over the last 30 years. We will be back and will enjoy the Hilton again. Spend some time on the travel web sites and google maps before going and enjoy!
reviews.title: Impressive!

reviews.text: Hilton Budapest was excellent. Rooms are large, clean and bathroom was spacious & either brand new or newly renovated. We did not have a view but our room rate was economical so we could not complain.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — Large, clean guestrooms; great bathroom; great lobb bar.

reviews.text: The lobby is big with plenty of room to sit and relax while waiting to head out sightseeing. Lobby bar was comfortable and service was excellent, although a little pricy - but worth it as we liked having a comfortable lobby bar in a foreign city!
reviews.title: For us the best hotel in the best location in Budapest

likes.disliked: — Smoking in the bar and lobby area by the elevators--it was the first thing you noticed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The concierge was not very helpful when our early AM flight was cancelled or for assistance with sightseeing tours, but the front desk staff was efficient and friendly. We had a poor experience in the makeshift restaurant during the breakfast buffet, but that could have been due to the fact that they were renovating the real restaurant area.
reviews.title: Classic Hospitality in a great city!

likes.liked: — The stunning location, the Executive lounge, the large bed and the views!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The absolute only possible downside to this hotel is that it is across the river from all the bars, restaurants and nightlife (it is located in Buda), however, taxis were plentiful and we didnt mind taking them back and forth at nighttime. The upside is that you are adjacent to the Castle and can visit that without having to take any public transportation. All of the bus tours also pick up and drop off right near the hotel entrance.
reviews.title: Great location fantastic views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I had a fantastic 3 nights at the Hilton in Budapest Castle district. I had planned for a romantic trip to celebrate my wife’s birthday and it couldn’t have been a better location. We had a room at the third floor with a view to the pest side of the city which is a great sight at any time. We also had access to the executive lounge, which is a great treat, as you always have access to drinks and refreshments in a very nice environment overlooking the parliament building on the other side of the river.
reviews.title: The perfect base for a romantic trip to a Budapest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service at the hotel was great and the standard of the hotel is what you expect of a Hilton. We only tried the Icon restaurant for breakfast, which offered a great variety of foods and drinks and always provided by friendly and service minded personnel.
reviews.title: great hotel with wonderful service

reviews.text: Having experienced Budapest for the first time we both agreed that we prefer living in the castle district as we preferred to spend the day on the Pest side seeing sights and shopping and then walk back to the castle district for dinner. This way we experienced the sights and romantic streets at the Buda hill in the morning and in the evening, where it is the most beautiful.
reviews.title: Great Location-a bit tired

reviews.text: The only areas we found the hotel could develop on are minor. The hotel TV could offer English entertainment channels as we only found the usual international news channels and Eurosport, and that was it in terms of English language channels. We would have liked to have had channels such as TCM or Discovery, but again this is a minor thing.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all the luxurious hotel from 1976 (first Hilton in Eastern Europe by the way) served as the perfect base for our romantic trip to a fantastic city.
reviews.title: Amazing Location
Fantastic hotel and service...
reviews.text: This is a great hotel. The service is amazing and the view is stunning. I am a diamond Hilton honors member and found this hotel to be a top notch Hilton. The area around the hotel is beautiful. I would return to this hotel anytime I am in Budapest.

This Hilton is dated but the service and the room was good. The room I had on the Executive Floor was spacious and comfortable, with a nice large bath that included both a shower and a tub. The bed was my only complaint, as it was hard as a board which I suppose is better than soft and worn. I did not have a view, but a spectacular view is only a moments walk to the rear of the hotel. I also walked around the Castle district which includes some great buildings. I agree with other reviews that the nightlife is limited, and although there are lots of restaurants within walking distance most of them are higher-end and not much in the way of casual dining. After having visited other parts of the city, I think I would have rather stayed on the Pest side since there appears to be much more entertainment and dining options; the Castle district gets rather dead at night (although I felt quite safe walking the streets at any time of the day and evening). The staff at the Executive Floor lounge was fantastic; very attentive and friendly. My primary complaint about the hotel overall is the lack of dining options. You can get a few items at the bar, and some snacks at the Executive Lounge, but the only restaurant for dinner was the Dominican Restaurant which again seemed more upscale and not what I was looking for after a long day or work.
reviews.title: Good Hotel In Buda
Great Views but Outdates
reviews.text: This Hilton has an amazing location and amazing views of the Danube River and the Pest side of Budapest, especially the Parliament buildings. But the hotel itself leaves a bit to be desired. It is very

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: outdated in terms of decor---stuck in the 1970's and 1980's, and the music played throughout the hotel in the public areas, lounges, elevators, etc is all 1970's. Desk staff was friendly but hotel manager wasn't helpful at all when we complained that we had been ripped off by one of the hotel's taxis (taxi scams are a major issue in Budapest). Executive lounge staff was extremely helpful and friendly, but the food wasn't very good there. On a scale of 1-10, with 10 being the best, I'd give this a 5. Probably wouldn't stay there again.
reviews.title: It's okay, but nothing special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hilton commands a good location on the castle district which is great for sightseeing by day, but is otherwise a very quiet area at night particularly outside of the tourist season.
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel, If Price and Location Aren't a Concern

likes.disliked: — Costs for room, food/drinks, services were relatively high

reviews.title: excellent breakfast and very comfy room
reviews.text: The staffs were very friendly and helpful; the breakfast was excellent. We stayed in the standard room and it was a good size room with mini bar and clean bathroom. the only down side was the week we stayed the hotel was carry out some interior refurbishment, and there was noise in the early morning :( part from that, everything is wonderful; i would recommend this hotel !!

reviews.title: Thoroughly underwhelming
reviews.text: Lured by the prospect of gaining some extra HH points and treating my partner for his big 50, I booked us into the Hilton Buda Castle for three nights and now wished I hadn't. The service is pretty poor. I reported problems getting onto the hotel's internet - by the way, they charge a hefty price - and only after four times of contacting guest services/ reception it was finally resolved. Breakfast is okay but don't expect to be brought hot beverages, the first two mornings I had to disturb the waiters who were chatting happily along twice before I was brought a coffee (for milk I had to ask again). The rooms are average at best, the furniture in our room were full of scratches and I felt tempted to etch a chirpy "replace me!" into it before remembering my Berlin working class roots.

reviews.title: hotel at beautiful location
reviews.text: Castle District is arguably the most beautiful part of Budapest and the Hilton is located next to the St Mathias church (one of the most beautiful church we'd ever seen). Great location and service was up to expectations. Only complaints was Internet charges was quite expensive. I think they outsourced it to a 3rd party and every night i had to call the company's (not Hilton's) helpline to get them to check their "gateway" or else I couldn't connect to the hotel wifi. Was also charged for these calls by the hotel although technically I shouldn't be paying for these since it's a hotel/internet company problem but couldn't be bothered to explain or argue with the hotel.

reviews.title: Nice location, Unfriendly Staff
reviews.text: Problem in general with the Castle District though is that most restaurants and pubs shuts at 11. We arrived around midnight and had problem sourcing for food around the area. Resorted to room service but they only had the midnight menu (as kitchen shuts at 11:30 pm) and the selection was pretty poor.

reviews.title: Wonderful hotel in a great location!
reviews.text: We spend two nights on a family treep during Whit Monday weekend.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hilton for New Years Eve and had a really good time. Our room was immaculately clean, the staff were helpful, and the breakfast buffet was good too.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, excellent location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hilton provided us with a free 'pick-up' service to and from the airport by means of a 24hr service mini-bus. That said I have just looked at their website and it says 'for a small charge' so maybe it's no longer free!?! Anyway it was very easy, just go to the Airport Minibus Service Desk in the airport arrival hall and check-in. You shouldn't have to wait too long for a bus (we only waited 5 mins) but the journey time can vary as it does stop at other hotels too... we didn't mind as we were new to Budapest so we just sat back and gazed out of the bus window! Then, before you leave, get the concierge to arrange the return journey. Easy!
reviews.title: Fabulous location

reviews.text: The Hilton is situated on top of a hill, sandwiched between the Fishermen's Bastion and the Mátyás Church, overlooking the River Danube and across to the Parliment building and the Chain Bridge.... so you've basically got four of Budapests main attractions on your door step. The view from the hotel is fabulous, especially at night.
reviews.title: Great view

reviews.text: The only small problem with the location, being on top of a steep hill, is that the nearest metro stations are a little bit of a walk down hill, which can be exhausting on the way back up... it snowed heavily while we were there so it was really slippery too!
reviews.title: beautiful location

likes.liked: — great location------clean, big room ---great service, friendly helpful staff

reviews.text: I would highly recommend dining at the 'Rivalda Cafe & Restaurant'. The food was great, they had a good and varied selection to chose from and it's within easy walking distance from the Hilton. Head towards the castle and it's situated near the Castle Theatre on the left handside of the road.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: As others have said, the location of this hotel is perfect. Our room (275) had such a great view looking across the Danube towards the Parliament building that we took a picture with our ipad and sent it to family instead of a postcard.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

reviews.text: The room was clean, spacious, and well-decorated; the staff was friendly and helpful; the wi-fi was free in the lobby; and there were three good restaurants within a short walking distance. The buffet breakfast, which was part of our package, was convenient, but nothing special.
reviews.title: Stunning Position

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are in fairly good shape, it was an easy walk down the hill to the river, to cross the Chain Bridge and explore the Pest side. Obviously take the funicular back up.
reviews.title: Peerless view of the city across the Danube

reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: My experience in Budapest

reviews.text: The Hilton in Buda is in a class of its own. We stayed here over my birthday and was surprised when a bottle of Champagne was delivered to our room with the managers complements.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel in beautiful Budapest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stunning view of the Danube and the Pest side of the city, overlooking Fisherman's Bastion. Great little restaurants within two blocks. Three blocks away from the Castle complex, the Presidential Palace.and the tramway down to the bridge crossing into the Pest side of the city. Rooms were large and modern. Residential area so its very quiet.
reviews.title: Trip to Eastern Europe
Budapest Hilton October 2013
reviews.text: This Hotel is one of the best we have ever stayed in ... the million dollar (Euro) view from our window showed Fisherman's Bastion, the Danube River and the Parliaments Buildings on the Pest side. The hotel room, amenities, and staff were the best. We were sorry to leave. It has my highest recommendation.

reviews.title: Nice views of Pest and Buda Castle
reviews.text: We had a nice suite with amazing views of Buda castle. The breakfast buffet was good with extensive selection of pastries and cold cuts. The concierge was really attentive and recommended a few places.

We actually stayed here twice this summer. Once I shared a twin bedded room with Danube view and breakfast with my mother. The view of the Danube was perfect, worth the price! Looked straight out onto the Parliament, Fisherman's Bastion, and Margaret Island was visible in the distance. The view was so wonderful we decided to stay in and ordered room service for dinner - Expensive, but with tired feet from a full day of sightseeing and the gorgeous view - it was worth it. The buffet breakfast was nice, with a good assortment of hot offerings, fresh fruit, pastries etc, even a few Hungarian touches. Then later in the summer we had two rooms, a king for my husband and myself and an executive junior suite for our son's family of four. We didn't pay for a view but our room had a pretty view of Matyas Church and a slice of the Danube. The executive room came with privileges to the Executive Lounge. Our son, wife, 6 and 4 year olds filled up with enough cheese and hors d'oeuvres in the lounge that they skipped dinner that night. They enjoyed their breakfast there too. Their room had a view out to the street - right across from a pretty "Romeo and Juliet" balcony. The parking has changed. Other years you could park on the street for free, now there is a charge for street parking. You need to get a voucher from the desk at checkout.
reviews.title: Another Wonderful Stay
Wonderful if you get the right room
reviews.text: As part of our Viking River Cruise we stayed at the Hilton in the Castle District of BUDAPEST. We had a room on the top floor facing the Danube River and the Parliament Building. Breathtaking view. Not all rooms have this view. When you check in ask for a high floor with a river view.

reviews.title: Wonderful stay!
reviews.text: Couldn't have been more pleased with the our room, tasty buffet breakfast, small but well equipped fitness center, helpfulness of staff and especially Guest Relations, Jolina, who went above and beyond to help with a purchase I wanted to make for my daughters.

reviews.title: I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else in Budapest.
reviews.text: This was my first visit to Budapest and a Hilton Hotel: both were impressive.

reviews.title: great hotel
reviews.text: Travelling alone I expected to be placed in a tiny single room, so I was delighted to find myself in a spacious double room. The room was immaculate with plenty of storage space. The bathroom was modern and well stocked with complimentary toiletries. Housekeeping was thorough and did an excellent job every day. The mini-bar prices were extortionate, as was the breakfast. I opted to have my breakfast in the local restaurants and paid a quarter of what the hotel charged.

reviews.title: Excellent service, a real pleasure
reviews.text: The Castle Hill district is definitely the most beautiful, picturesque and peaceful part of Budapest in which to stay. Outside of my bedroom window I had the magnificent Matthias Church and just behind the hotel is Fishermen's Bastion. There are a handful of lovely restaurants and a mini-market virtually on your doorstep. Admittedly you are not bang in the centre of the city (and yes the restaurants do close early) but you are only 5-10 minutes from the centre courtesy of the No.16 bus.

reviews.title: very helpful service, and information
reviews.text: If you are in Budapest for a few days I would recommend that you buy a travelcard for the duration of your stay. It's cheap, convenient and allows you to hop on and off the city's transportation system as you wish without fear of being stopped and fined by an inspector. Just remember to write your name on the ticket!

I spent three nights at the hotel and have only good things to stay. I used points that got me to the executive suite floor. A waiter there at night named Tibor couldn't do enough for us. Clone this man, and the world would be a better place!
reviews.title: Terrific stay

reviews.text: We needed an extra bed -- a cot -- in our room, and the staff brought it without delay.
reviews.title: OK, but definitely not a 5-star hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is ideally situated because of the inspiring views and interesting sites nearby on the castle hill. You can visit the beautiful parts of Budapest below by walking down the hill and crossing either the Chain Bridge or the Margaret Bridge or by taking the 16A bus that will take you to Deak Ferenc Square. It's only a couple of blocks from must-see Andrassy Avenue.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, right next to St. Mattias Church and the Fisherman's Wharf; 5 minute walk from the Castle. Beautiful view of the Parliament from the room. The rooms are somewhat dated. Comfortable beds with pretty dated linens with stains and marks. Service did not meet expectations. No one greeted us when we arrived even though there were a bunch of bell boys hanging around; I guess no one had told them that they were supposed to great customers. Also, when we took our luggage downstairs to check out, no one offered us to help with the luggage. The breakfast was quite good; big variety, but again the service was sub-par; sometimes it seemed that the waiters either didn't speak English or were never told what their responsibilities were. The Concierge was very helpful: organized a private tour + recommended a couple of amazing restaurants. The Internet connection was 42 Euros/ day, so we chose not to order it. Overall, whereas we had a good time in Budapest, this felt like a 3-star hotel by US measures. For $320/ night, I expected more. I would not recommend this hotel, as it is subpar relative to other Hilton hotels.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: Stayed 7 nights at the hotel. The location is a bit ambivalent, on one hand you are in the middle of the castle hill surrounded by sightseeing highlights and with a great view over Budapest on the other hand you are away from the bustling city center of the Pest side.
reviews.title: Good place to stay when visiting Budapest

description: The Hilton Budapest is located in the city’s historic Castle District, and has magnificent views over the River Danube, the centre of Pest and the romantic, narrow, cobbled streets of old Buda.TripAdvisor published a list of the top 10 hotel rooms in the world with the most beautiful views in March 2012. Hilton Budapest is proud to announce that the hotel was on the list.It takes only ten minutes to get to the Pest side by the bus which has a stop next to the hotel.Mammut one of the largest shopping mall is only five minutes away by walk.
